title: How to Make Your Bedroom More Appealing to You Without Redoing It

steps.headline: Before you even start, open the curtains and the windows and put on some music-but not your favourite, or you'll get distracted and start dancing!
Tidy your room!
steps.description: Don't spend hours doing this, just grab yourself 2 bin bags, a cardboard box and a tray. Put all the dirty clothes in one bin bag, and clean clothes back into your wardrobe/closet/drawers. Then put all rubbish in the other bin bag and anything that shouldn't be in your room (like cups and stuff you borrowed from your mum)on the tray. Put the tray in the hall to be sorted later. Put anything else lying around the room in the box and tuck the box out of sight.

steps.headline: Once your room is tidy, stand in the middle of the room and look around.
steps.description: Look bigger, doesn't it? Even just tidying your room can make it a nicer place to be.

steps.headline: Now start to think of what you want to do with your room.
steps.description: Perhaps that table is in an inconvenient place? Or maybe your desk is looking a bit cluttered? Have a nice long think about it.

steps.headline: Once you are sure what you want to achieve, get to it!
steps.description: Start with what you want to achieve the most.

steps.headline: If you want to move any furniture around, take anything off the top of the furniture that's to be moved.
steps.description: BE sure to get somebody to help you and move the furniture SLOWLY AND CAREFULLY.

steps.headline: Then arrange everything on the surfaces of the furniture.
steps.description: Too much stuff on your desk? Put some of the stuff on the top of your chest of drawers. This looks cool and helps even out the amount of clutter.

steps.headline: Make the bed and if you have any cushions lying around, place them on the bed, next to the pillows, in a nice 'pile'
Take down any posters or pictures from the walls.
steps.description: Decide where you want the posters to go, or if you want to put them back up at all.

steps.headline: Sit back and enjoy your new space!

text: Before you even start, open the curtains and the windows and put on some music-but not your favourite, or you'll get distracted and start dancing!  Tidy your room! Don't spend hours doing this, just grab yourself 2 bin bags, a cardboard box and a tray. Put all the dirty clothes in one bin bag, and clean clothes back into your wardrobe/closet/drawers. Then put all rubbish in the other bin bag and anything that shouldn't be in your room (like cups and stuff you borrowed from your mum)on the tray. Put the tray in the hall to be sorted later. Put anything else lying around the room in the box and tuck the box out of sight. Once your room is tidy, stand in the middle of the room and look around. Look bigger, doesn't it? Even just tidying your room can make it a nicer place to be. Now start to think of what you want to do with your room. Perhaps that table is in an inconvenient place? Or maybe your desk is looking a bit cluttered? Have a nice long think about it. Once you are sure what you want to achieve, get to it! Start with what you want to achieve the most. If you want to move any furniture around, take anything off the top of the furniture that's to be moved. BE sure to get somebody to help you and move the furniture SLOWLY AND CAREFULLY. Then arrange everything on the surfaces of the furniture. Too much stuff on your desk? Put some of the stuff on the top of your chest of drawers. This looks cool and helps even out the amount of clutter. Make the bed and if you have any cushions lying around, place them on the bed, next to the pillows, in a nice 'pile'  Take down any posters or pictures from the walls. Decide where you want the posters to go, or if you want to put them back up at all. Sit back and enjoy your new space!
